full_summary:
Emergency Electrical Power Supply Systems
Systèmes d’alimentation électrique de secours
### Tender Notice

**Tender Reference Number**: #PW-__FK-317-81466
**Posting Date: 2022-12-01**

### Opportunity Details

#### Tendering Procedure
A Request for Proposal (RFP) is hereby announced. All interested suppliers are invited to submit their bids.

**Competitive Procurement Strategy**: Lowest/Lower Bid
**Trade Agreement**: None

#### Procurement Category
This procurement falls under the category of **CNST**, with a scope of work involving **Generator Maintenance** ( **Générator - entretien** ).

#### Requested Goods or Services
The Government of Canada, through Public Works and Government Services Canada, invites suppliers to bid on providing **maintenance services** for the Emergency Electrical Power Supply Systems. The main objectives of these services are to ensure the integrity and uninterrupted performance of the systems.

#### Period of Resulting Contract
The contract term will be for a period of five (5) years.

#### Basis of Selection
A bid must meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award.

#### Site Visit Requirements
A site visit has been scheduled for December 15th, 2022, at the Food Production Facility (1170 Algoma Road, Ottawa, ON). Security screenings are mandatory prior to gaining access to the site. Bidders must confirm attendance and provide the name(s) of personnel holding valid security clearance by December 8th, 2022.

### Key Dates
- **Tender Closing Date**: January 11th, 2023 at 2:00 pm EST
- **Site Visit Date**: December 15th, 2022 at 9:30 am EST

### Contact Information
For any inquiries, please contact:
Martin Gauthier
Phone: (613) 404-8642
Email: martin.gauthier@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Security Requirements
Security requirements are attached to this tender. Bidders must ensure compliance with all security provisions.

### Terms and Conditions
The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Tenderers must provide a valid security clearance for site visit access.

### Important Notes
Bidder must refer to Part 2 - Bidder Instructions, and Part 3 - Bid Preparation Instructions, in the bid solicitation, for
